body:
Can you install numpy in your virtualenv? I can't tell whether it's pandas
or numpy install that's causing the error.

Sure. After a myriad of warnings:

   ........ 
    changing mode of build/scripts.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/f2py from 644 to 755

```
changing mode of /Users/hernan/Envs/pandas/bin/f2py to 755
```

Successfully installed numpy
Cleaning up...
(pandas)~ $ 
(pandas)~ $ 
(pandas)~ $ python
Python 2.7.2 (default, Oct 11 2012, 20:14:37) 
[GCC 4.2.1 Compatible Apple Clang 4.0 (tags/Apple/clang-418.0.60)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

> > > import numpy
> > > 
> > > x = numpy.linspace(0, 10, 5000)
> > > x
> > > array([  0.00000000e+00,   2.00040008e-03,   4.00080016e-03, ...,
> > >          9.99599920e+00,   9.99799960e+00,   1.00000000e+01])
> > > 
> > > ^D
> > > (pandas)~ $

Oh... It seems that now I can install pandas too. Might have fixed while installing numpy and pandas separately.
Output:

```
.........
clang -bundle -undefined dynamic_lookup -Wl,-F. -arch i386 -arch x86_64 build/temp.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/pandas/src/ujson/python/ujson.o build/temp.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/pandas/src/ujson/python/objToJSON.o build/temp.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/pandas/src/ujson/python/JSONtoObj.o build/temp.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/pandas/src/ujson/lib/ultrajsonenc.o build/temp.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/pandas/src/ujson/lib/ultrajsondec.o build/temp.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/pandas/src/datetime/np_datetime.o build/temp.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/pandas/src/datetime/np_datetime_strings.o -o build/lib.macosx-10.8-intel-2.7/pandas/json.so
```
